repnme.cdata!: Russia - Bureau of Economic Analysis Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Although the project outcome is rated
            satisfactory, its sustainability is unlikely, yet,
            institutional development impacts were substantial, and
            performances by the Bank and Borrower also satisfactory.
            Lessons first indicate that assistance in improving the
            government access to sound economic advice, in key areas of
            the reform strategy pays off in terms of deepening the
            quality and ownership of institutional reforms, and
            therefore their sustainability. Second, that by establishing
            the think-tank as an independent entity, yet with a
            governance structure that makes it fully accountable to the
            government, allows to maintain objectivity of the analysis,
            and recommendations, while preventing the institution from
            deviating into researching topics of purely academic
            significance. The Project shows how important it is to build
            capacity for quality public policy analysis in the design of
            an appropriate market model, in how to generate demand, in
            how to deal with the informational asymmetries that cause
            inefficient use of resources, and in how to ensure
            independence and objectivity avoiding political capture of
            an institution. Third, that for achieving all of the above,
            the quality oversight of the research on the Bank side plays
            an important role. It makes supervision labor-intensive
            because it requires involvement of a broad team of Bank
            staff in reviewing key analytical products of an
            institution. Fourth, that long-term financing of
            institutions, should be based on very solid assumptions,
            i.e., creating highly professional institutions within the
            public sector is contingent upon public sector salaries
            being attractive - often not realistic - thus project design
            should take into account options that foster public-private partnerships.

repnme.cdata!:
Russian Federation - Bureau of Economic
            Analysis Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal development objective of
            the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) Project is to build
            institutional capacity for sound economic analysis in
            support of market-oriented structural reforms. To meet this
            objective, the project has three sub-goals: (1) to increase
            the quantity and quality of cross-sectoral economic policy
            studies for government use; (2) to establish the BEA outside
            of but accountable to government, for an objective,
            economy-wide perspective in assessing economic policy
            options, and (3) to improve the reliability of the national
            accounts as a basis for sound economic analysis. The project
            will finance three components: (1) Policy studies- for local
            and international consultants, and to obtain data to use in
            medium-term policy studies focused on macroeconomic analysis
            and public finance, social policy, and enterprise economics
            and financial sector reform; for production of the annual
            report, quarterly indicators, and quick-response policy
            notes, and for databases to support these initiatives; (2)
            Bureau of Economic Analysis- for the technical and human
            resources needed to increase capacity for economic policy
            analysis both in the BEA and in the core economic
            ministries, including computer and information technology, a
            library, on-line databases, and training, study tours, and
            fellowships; and (3) Improvement of national accounts- for
            computer equipment, training, and technical assistance
            needed to improve the quality of economic statistics.
